description: Weekly short tests during practical/tutorial classes with 2 multiple-choice questions each. 16 quizzes administered, with lowest 3 scores excluded. Focuses on weekly lecture and class content.
Mid-term assessment identifying neural structures from images/sections and answering theory questions. Covers weeks 1-5 material. 50-minute in-person test with MCQs and short answers.
End-term assessment identifying neural structures (including MRI/CT scans) and answering theory questions. Covers weeks 7-10 material. 50-minute in-person test during exam period.

Comprehensive 2-hour exam assessing structural/functional integration of nervous system knowledge. Includes 40 MCQs (60% of exam mark) and 2 written questions (40% of exam mark). Covers entire course content.
